title: Grebo (1868) Matthew
description:
Grebo is spoken by an estimated 100,000 people in coastal and inland areas of Liberia, from the Ivory Coast. It is sometimes divided and ‘Bush’ Grebo, although other divisions are used by the Grebos themselves. Grebo is a Kru language.

1838 Matthew; 1841 Mark; American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions,Cape Palmas; Translated by Leighton Wilson, ABCFM. J.; 1848 Luke 1850 Genesis 1851 Acts 1852John 1866 Romans 1868 Matthew 1 Corinthians ABS, NewYork, Translated by John Payne, ABCFM.
